general_advisory: Jagatsinghpur district is likely to receive light to moderate rainfall for the next five days. Keeping rainfall forecast in mind farmers are advised not to do any type of spray and do proper drainage management in pulse crops and vegetable nurseries. After rainfall recedes apply top dressing of fertilizers either in transplanted or direct seeded rice. Regular monitoring for occurrence of insects and diseases in crops is highly recommended due to prevailing weather conditions.

advisory: Tillering to Panicle Initiation stage: Swarming Caterpillar may infest the crops. To manage, spray Chlorpyriphos 50% + Cypermethrin 5% EC @ 400-ml/acre or Lambda-cyhalothrin @ 400-ml/acre

Vegetative stage: Fall Army Worm infestation may increase after rainfall. To manage, use biopesticide Beauveria bassiana @ 1200-gram/acre. Apply chemical sprays like Emamectin Benzoate 5% S.G@ 80-gram/acre if necessary.
Nursery stage: Damping off disease may occur. Manage by drenching nursery bed with Captan or Copper Oxychloride
Grow resistant varieties in September nursery raising
Vegetative to Fruiting stage: Control Crown rot by spraying Copper Oxychloride or Carbendazim
Vegetative to Fruiting stage: Provide drainage and stake plants for Sigatoka disease. Spray Mancozeb or Zineb as precautionary measures.
